trans-unit.source: This article describes how to quickly display the camera preview stream within a XAML page in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to quickly display the camera preview stream within a XAML page in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

trans-unit.source: Simple camera preview access
trans-unit.target: Simple camera preview access

trans-unit.source: Simple camera preview access
trans-unit.target: Simple camera preview access

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to quickly display the camera preview stream within a XAML page in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to quickly display the camera preview stream within a XAML page in a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

trans-unit.source: Creating an app that captures photos and videos using the camera requires you to perform tasks like handling device and camera orientation or setting encoding options for the captured file.
trans-unit.target: Creating an app that captures photos and videos using the camera requires you to perform tasks like handling device and camera orientation or setting encoding options for the captured file.

trans-unit.source: For some app scenarios, you may want to just simply show the preview stream from the camera without worrying about these other considerations.
trans-unit.target: For some app scenarios, you may want to just simply show the preview stream from the camera without worrying about these other considerations.

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to do that with a minimum of code.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to do that with a minimum of code.

trans-unit.source: Note that you should always shut down the preview stream properly when you are done with it by following the steps below.
trans-unit.target: Note that you should always shut down the preview stream properly when you are done with it by following the steps below.

trans-unit.source: For information on writing a camera app that captures photos or videos, see [Capture photos and video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md).
trans-unit.target: For information on writing a camera app that captures photos or videos, see [Capture photos and video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md).

trans-unit.source: Add capability declarations to the app manifest
trans-unit.target: Add capability declarations to the app manifest

trans-unit.source: In order for your app to access a device's camera, you must declare that your app uses the *webcam* and *microphone* device capabilities.
trans-unit.target: In order for your app to access a device's camera, you must declare that your app uses the *webcam* and *microphone* device capabilities.

trans-unit.source: If you want to save captured photos and videos to the users's Pictures or Videos library, you must also declare the *picturesLibrary* and *videosLibrary* capability.
trans-unit.target: If you want to save captured photos and videos to the users's Pictures or Videos library, you must also declare the *picturesLibrary* and *videosLibrary* capability.

trans-unit.source: Add capabilities to the app manifest
trans-unit.target: Add capabilities to the app manifest

trans-unit.source: In Microsoft Visual Studio, in **Solution Explorer**, open the designer for the application manifest by double-clicking the **package.appxmanifest** item.
trans-unit.target: In Microsoft Visual Studio, in **Solution Explorer**, open the designer for the application manifest by double-clicking the **package.appxmanifest** item.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Capabilities** tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Capabilities** tab.

trans-unit.source: Check the box for **Webcam** and the box for **Microphone**.
trans-unit.target: Check the box for **Webcam** and the box for **Microphone**.

trans-unit.source: For access to the Pictures and Videos library check the boxes for **Pictures Library** and the box for **Videos Library**.
trans-unit.target: For access to the Pictures and Videos library check the boxes for **Pictures Library** and the box for **Videos Library**.

trans-unit.source: Add a CaptureElement to your page
trans-unit.target: Add a CaptureElement to your page

trans-unit.source: Use a [**CaptureElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209278) to display the preview stream within your XAML page.
trans-unit.target: Use a [**CaptureElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209278) to display the preview stream within your XAML page.

trans-unit.source: CaptureElement
trans-unit.target: CaptureElement

trans-unit.source: Use MediaCapture to start the preview stream
trans-unit.target: Use MediaCapture to start the preview stream

trans-unit.source: The [**MediaCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241124) object is your app's interface to the device's camera.
trans-unit.target: The [**MediaCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241124) object is your app's interface to the device's camera.

trans-unit.source: This class is a member of the Windows.Media.Capture namespace.
trans-unit.target: This class is a member of the Windows.Media.Capture namespace.

trans-unit.source: The example in this article also uses APIs from the [**Windows.ApplicationModel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224691) and [System.Threading.Tasks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.threading.tasks.aspx) namespaces, in addition to those included by the default project template.
trans-unit.target: The example in this article also uses APIs from the [**Windows.ApplicationModel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224691) and [System.Threading.Tasks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/system.threading.tasks.aspx) namespaces, in addition to those included by the default project template.

trans-unit.source: CaptureElement
trans-unit.target: CaptureElement

trans-unit.source: Declare a class variable for the **MediaCapture** object.
trans-unit.target: Declare a class variable for the **MediaCapture** object.

trans-unit.source: SimpleCameraPreviewUsing
trans-unit.target: SimpleCameraPreviewUsing

trans-unit.source: Create a new instance of the **MediaCapture** class and call [**InitializeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226598) to initialize the capture device.
trans-unit.target: Create a new instance of the **MediaCapture** class and call [**InitializeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226598) to initialize the capture device.

trans-unit.source: This method may fail, on devices that don't have a camera for example, so you should call it from within a **try** block.
trans-unit.target: This method may fail, on devices that don't have a camera for example, so you should call it from within a **try** block.

trans-unit.source: An **UnauthorizedAccessException** will be thrown when you attempt to initialize the camera if the user has disabled camera access in the device's privacy settings.
trans-unit.target: An **UnauthorizedAccessException** will be thrown when you attempt to initialize the camera if the user has disabled camera access in the device's privacy settings.

trans-unit.source: You will also see this exception during development if you have neglected to add the proper capabilities to your app manifest.
trans-unit.target: You will also see this exception during development if you have neglected to add the proper capabilities to your app manifest.

trans-unit.source: Connect the **MediaCapture** to the **CaptureElement** by setting the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209280) property.
trans-unit.target: Connect the **MediaCapture** to the **CaptureElement** by setting the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209280) property.

trans-unit.source: Finally, start the preview by calling [**StartPreviewAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226613).
trans-unit.target: Finally, start the preview by calling [**StartPreviewAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226613).

trans-unit.source: DeclareMediaCapture
trans-unit.target: DeclareMediaCapture

trans-unit.source: Shut down the preview stream
trans-unit.target: Shut down the preview stream

trans-unit.source: When you are done using the preview stream, you should always shut down the stream and properly dispose of the associated resources to ensure that the camera is available to other apps on the device.
trans-unit.target: When you are done using the preview stream, you should always shut down the stream and properly dispose of the associated resources to ensure that the camera is available to other apps on the device.

trans-unit.source: The required steps for shutting down the preview stream are:
trans-unit.target: The required steps for shutting down the preview stream are:

trans-unit.source: Call [**StopPreviewAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226622) to stop the preview stream.
trans-unit.target: Call [**StopPreviewAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226622) to stop the preview stream.

trans-unit.source: Set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209280) property of the **CaptureElement** to null.
trans-unit.target: Set the [**Source**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209280) property of the **CaptureElement** to null.

trans-unit.source: Call the **MediaCapture** object's [**Dispose**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278858) method to release the object.
trans-unit.target: Call the **MediaCapture** object's [**Dispose**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278858) method to release the object.

trans-unit.source: Set the **MediaCapture** member variable to null.
trans-unit.target: Set the **MediaCapture** member variable to null.

trans-unit.source: CleanupCameraAsync
trans-unit.target: CleanupCameraAsync

trans-unit.source: You should shut down the preview stream when the user navigates away from your page by overriding the [**OnNavigatedFrom**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227507) method.
trans-unit.target: You should shut down the preview stream when the user navigates away from your page by overriding the [**OnNavigatedFrom**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227507) method.

trans-unit.source: OnNavigatedFrom
trans-unit.target: OnNavigatedFrom

trans-unit.source: You should also shut down the preview stream properly when your app is suspending.
trans-unit.target: You should also shut down the preview stream properly when your app is suspending.

trans-unit.source: To do this, register a handler for the [**Application.Suspending**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br205860) event in your page's constructor.
trans-unit.target: To do this, register a handler for the [**Application.Suspending**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br205860) event in your page's constructor.

trans-unit.source: RegisterSuspending
trans-unit.target: RegisterSuspending

trans-unit.source: In the **Suspending** event handler, first check to make sure that the page is being displayed the application's [**Frame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242682) by comparing the page type to the [**CurrentSourcePageType**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh702390) property.
trans-unit.target: In the **Suspending** event handler, first check to make sure that the page is being displayed the application's [**Frame**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242682) by comparing the page type to the [**CurrentSourcePageType**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh702390) property.

trans-unit.source: If the page is not currently being displayed, then the **OnNavigatedFrom** event should already have been raised and the preview stream shut down.
trans-unit.target: If the page is not currently being displayed, then the **OnNavigatedFrom** event should already have been raised and the preview stream shut down.

trans-unit.source: If the page is currently being displayed, get a [**SuspendingDeferral**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224684) object from the event args passed into the handler to make sure the system does not suspend your app until the preview stream has been shut down.
trans-unit.target: If the page is currently being displayed, get a [**SuspendingDeferral**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224684) object from the event args passed into the handler to make sure the system does not suspend your app until the preview stream has been shut down.

trans-unit.source: After shutting down the stream, call the deferral's [**Complete**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224685) method to let the system continue suspending your app.
trans-unit.target: After shutting down the stream, call the deferral's [**Complete**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224685) method to let the system continue suspending your app.

trans-unit.source: SuspendingHandler
trans-unit.target: SuspendingHandler

trans-unit.source: Capture a still image from the preview stream
trans-unit.target: Capture a still image from the preview stream

trans-unit.source: It's simple to get a still image from the media capture preview stream in the form of a [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358).
trans-unit.target: It's simple to get a still image from the media capture preview stream in the form of a [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Get a preview frame](get-a-preview-frame.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Get a preview frame](get-a-preview-frame.md).
